column4: I'm reading about Upstart in ubuntu and comparing it against daemontools. We currently use daemontools for two purposes - to startup and monitor a process, and to log the process output to a centralized location (via multilog). I understand Upstart does the former. Does it also facilitate logging?
you can use rsyslogd for the remote logging I guess
what kind of fs are you trying to mount ? mount -t that filesystem
